Dialogue Boxes - User Input

Now we will asking the player to answer a question and save their keyboard input in a variable. We will not use a virtual keyboard on a gamepad and just stick with a computer keyboard. Lets alter the first text to include a variable for the first name of the player. For this to work the variable has to be an array with only one item for example foo[0] = "foo_name";.

obj_player: Create Event

Adjust our salution from saying a generic player to the first name set by concatonating a reference to this string:

obj_npc_tiger: Create Event

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. The player is now greeted by their first name.

rm_castle

Now open the NPC's create event and we will need to split the salutation in two. We will need to add the new name in the collision event AFTER the player has entered it. We also need to ask a question to prompt the player to enter their name.

obj_npc_tiger: Create Event

Add a new script draw_dialogue_input(x, y, question, variable, id, player_id, space_above, typewriter_delay) as the first message box. Move all the others down by one. The only addition is the variable parameter which HAS to be an array with one item. The rest should be the same as previous with the question variable being a single string or a single array of a string.

Now edit the next message to concatonate the name.

obj_npc_tiger: Collision Event | obj_player

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. Now we should have the name entered reflected in game. This is all we have to demonstrate for message boxes.
